data.question: What is the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) at 90% RH and 70 °C?
How does the proton conductivity of Im-Cu@(NENU-3a) compare to Im@(NENU-3) under the same conditions?
data.answer: Im-Cu@(NENU-3a) has lower proton conductivity than Im@(NENU-3).

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) higher than that of Im-Fe-MOF at 60 °C and 98% RH?
What method was used for the synthesis of NENU-3?
data.answer: A previously reported procedure involving heating a mixture of Cu(NO3)2·3H2O, H3PW12O40·xH2O, H3BTC, and (CH3)4NOH·5H2O at 180 °C for 2 days.

data.question: What is the empirical formula for Im@(NENU-3)?
Does the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) remain stable over 12 hours at various relative humidity levels and 70 °C?
What is the activation energy (Ea) value for Im-Cu@(NENU-3a)?
Can Im@(NENU-3) maintain its structural integrity after AC impedance measurements?
What is the effect of imidazole loading on proton conductivity in Im@(NENU-3)?
data.answer: Higher imidazole loading in Im@(NENU-3) leads to higher proton conductivity.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) under anhydrous conditions at 70 °C significantly lower than under humid conditions?
What is the role of free imidazole molecules in Im@(NENU-3) for proton conduction?
data.answer: Free imidazole molecules significantly facilitate successive proton-hopping pathways through formation of hydrogen bonded networks.

data.question: Does the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) decrease with lower relative humidity?
What is the weight percentage of imidazole loading in Im@(NENU-3)?
How does the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) compare to Im-Fe-MOF at 60 °C and 98% RH?
data.answer: Im@(NENU-3) has slightly higher proton conductivity than Im-Fe-MOF.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) at 70 °C and 90% RH one of the highest among MOF-based proton conductors?
What is the effect of varying the amount of adsorbed imidazole on the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3)?
data.answer: The proton conductivity increases with the amount of adsorbed imidazole.

data.question: Does the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) remain stable in consecutive heating and cooling cycles?
What is the crystal system of Im-Cu@(NENU-3a)?
What is the role of lattice water molecules in Im-Cu@(NENU-3a) for proton conduction?
data.answer: Lattice water molecules are isolated by imidazole molecules, blocking the proton transport pathway.

data.question: Is the proton conductivity of Im@(NENU-3) at 70 °C and 0% RH extremely poor?
